column4: When I switch on my computer grub won't load the first kernel in the list. The kernel was upgraded sometime ago but I think the upgrade failed. As its grub 2 I cant edit the kernel list but the bigger problem is now I cant install any packages. I'm using ubuntu 8.04.4
This is a problem for me as my hardware wont run any more up to date release
that doesn't automatically means desktop is now supported
why won't your hardware run a more recent release?
Last I heard there is no graphics driver for my graphics card on any newer release.
Its a twin display matrox card of some description. Cant remember which one.
matrox themselves don't seem to be supporting the driver anymore (last release in 2006)
That's right. I got my card working using a driver from http://forum.tuxx-home.at/viewtopic.php?f=1&t=748&sid=0d433f4ca445cc74d20d384e0b68724a
i'm not sure what to suggest sorry
You would have no idea how to fix the problem with the package manager in ubuntu 8.04?
well the desktop support has ended for 8.04 so the repos are likely no longer functioning
Oh I didnt realise the repos would have gone. That explains it
that factoid was removed quite a while ago
